title: Album Page, "Campanile of San Zeno, Verona", late 19th century
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Verso, stamped in brown ink (inscribed in a small rectangular shield with notched corners); Cooper Union / Museum / New York.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 101; bottom right: Campanile of San Zeno / Verona.
description: Vertical sheet depicting at center a narrow, polychromed masonry tower with tiled steeple.  The tower is Romanesque in style with four levels of blind arcades with two levels of Ionic columns creating a triple arch enclosing the bell.  At the base of the steeple are two small towers replicating the steeple in miniature.  To the right of this drawing along the top edge is the campanile's finial with a ball and small cross in graphite.  At left of the campanile drawing is a plan showing a circle inscribed in a square with an X.  At the lower left of the square is another small square.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Campanile of San Zeno, Verona", late 19th century.Brush and watercolor, graphite on textured off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-35.
